Local Currency A bottle of Rhodian wine from one of the distinguished wineries on the island makes a perfect gift for friends at home. And, you can find the best olive oil, also known as liquid gold, as well as extraordinary honey, being sold out of private homes by local residents. Shopping for Bargains To begin your culinary adventure, simply visit one of the many tavernas and restaurants in Rhodes. Sample the mezedes, a variety of small Greek dishes and appetizers that are often served with the anise-flavored local aperitif, ouzo. Dolmades, a popular selection, are vine leaves filled with lamb and rice, then fried in oil and served cold. Another traditional dish is moussaka, made with potatoes, cheese, béchamel and eggplant.
